definition: to behave oneself/to abide by the rules
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
compass/a rule/regulation/to admonish/to plan/to scheme
variant of 規|规[gui1]
variant of 矩[ju3]
carpenter's square/rule/regulation/pattern/to carve

sentences.english: He's a badly-behaved boy. Nobody likes him.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个不守规矩的孩子，没有人喜欢他。

sentences.english: Becky was well-behaved at school but Adam was naughty.
sentences.chinese: 贝基在学校很守规矩，但是亚当很调皮。

sentences.english: Your lack of routine upsets this steady sign.
sentences.chinese: 你的不守规矩会让这个稳如泰山的星座苦恼不安。

sentences.english: In school, you knew if you misbehaved you would get the cane .
sentences.chinese: 在学校不守规矩是要挨藤条的。

sentences.english: Eg. The mother bade the child behave himself.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈叮咛孩子要守规矩。

sentences.english: If you misbehave yourself one more time, you'll be driven out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 如果你再不守规矩，就把你赶出屋去。

sentences.english: People who have been to Japan would have found them rather rule- abiding at public places.
sentences.chinese: 而到过日本的人，也会发现他们在公共场所很守规矩。

sentences.english: The mother bade the child behave himself.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈叮咛孩子要守规矩。

sentences.english: Mother told me to learn how to behave.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈要我好好学习守规矩。

sentences.english: Regulators try to tame the unruly parts of an important industry.
sentences.chinese: 监管部门努力驯服一个重要行业中不守规矩的角色。

sentences.english: She was such an unruly child that nobody could get along with her.
sentences.chinese: 她是一个不守规矩的孩子，没人能和他相处。

sentences.english: Ye Xintong said that some people don't behave properly, arbitrarily absenteeism.
sentences.chinese: 叶辛桐说有人不守规矩，随意旷工。

sentences.english: The boy behaved himself all day.
sentences.chinese: 那个男孩整天都很守规矩。

sentences.english: There's no king, the queen does fuck all and the blacks never follow the rules.
sentences.chinese: 没有王，女王啥事儿也不干，然后黑子不守规矩乱来。

sentences.english: I wish they would behave themselves.

definition: to carry out official duties and observe the law
to do what one is told/obedient
lit. compass and set square/fig. established standard/rule/customs/practices/fig. upright and honest/well-behaved
to be content with one's lot (idiom)/to know one's place
to strictly maintain
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
to stir up trouble
to be strict with oneself
to be strict with oneself (idiom)/to demand a lot of oneself
variant of 惹是生非[re3 shi4 sheng1 fei1]
to work/to handle matters/to have a job
to handle (affairs)/to work
(to play) one's part/one's role/one's duty/(to stay within) one's bounds/dutiful/keeping to one's role
content with one's lot/knowing one's place
to get smart/to resort to petty tricks
honest/sincere/well-behaved/open and guileless/naive
